description: This Honey Glazed Ham is the centerpiece of any festive gathering, boasting a sweet and savory glaze that caramelizes beautifully in the oven. With its tender meat and delightful aroma, it’s sure to impress your family and friends.
instructions: Score the ham in a diamond pattern, making shallow cuts across the surface.
Stud the ham with cloves, placing them in the intersections of the diamond pattern.
In a bowl, mix together the honey, brown sugar, and Dijon mustard until well combined.
Brush the glaze generously over the ham, ensuring it gets into the scored cuts.
Place the ham in a roasting pan and bake for 2 hours, basting frequently with the remaining glaze.
tips: For a perfect glaze, baste the ham every 30 minutes to keep it moist and flavorful.

structured_content.content: This Honey Glazed Ham is a showstopper that brings warmth and joy to any holiday table. The combination of honey, brown sugar, and Dijon mustard creates a sticky, sweet glaze that caramelizes beautifully, making each slice a delightful treat.

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this ham for a family gathering. The aroma filled the house, and everyone couldn't wait to dig in. It has since become a cherished tradition in our home, bringing everyone together around the table.

• Main ingredient: A bone-in ham is ideal for this recipe as it provides flavor and moisture during cooking.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Honey and brown sugar create a sweet glaze, while Dijon mustard adds a tangy kick.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Begin by preheating your oven and preparing the ham. Score it and stud it with cloves for flavor.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Brush the glaze over the ham and bake it, basting regularly to enhance the flavor and moisture.
Finishing Touches:
Once done, let the ham rest before slicing for the best presentation and flavor.

upload.context: Cooking process of honey glazed ham, capturing the basting and caramelization of the glaze.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure the internal temperature of the ham reaches 140°F (60°C) for safe consumption.
  • Avoid cutting too deep when scoring to prevent drying out the meat.
  • The glaze should be sticky and caramelized when the ham is ready.
  • Store leftovers in the refrigerator and reheat gently to maintain moisture.

structured_content.content: This ham has been a staple at our family gatherings, and sharing it with loved ones makes it even more special. It's a dish that brings everyone together, creating lasting memories around the dinner table.
Consider adding fresh herbs like rosemary or thyme to the glaze for an aromatic twist. You can also experiment with different mustards for varied flavor profiles.
Serve this ham with roasted vegetables, mashed potatoes, or a fresh salad. Pair it with a fruity wine or a classic apple cider for a delightful meal.
For a gluten-free option, ensure all ingredients are certified gluten-free. You can also try using maple syrup instead of honey for a different sweetness.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use a meat thermometer to ensure perfect doneness.
  • Let the ham rest before slicing to keep it juicy.
  • For an impressive appearance, garnish with fresh herbs and pineapple rings.
  • Consider making a glaze ahead of time to save on prep time.
